bibl.title: Patroclus Undressed: A Yale Papyrus with Homerica on Recto and Verso
bibl.note: P. CtYBR [P. Yale] Inv. 4673. Second or third century CE. The text on the recto is a paraliterary work with quotations from the Iliad on the topic of Achilles' armour, while on the verso are remains of a glossary to Iliad 5. - Introduction. - Content and Context. - Bibliological Features. - The Issue of Provenance. [Acquired from Galery Nefer in Zurich in 1997.] - Edition.
bibl.seg: Mark de Kreij & Daniela Colomo, Patroclus Undressed: A Yale Papyrus with Homerica on Recto and Verso.

P. CtYBR [P. Yale] Inv. 4673. Second or third century CE. The text on the recto is a paraliterary work with quotations from the Iliad on the topic of Achilles' armour, while on the verso are remains of a glossary to Iliad 5. - Introduction. - Content and Context. - Bibliological Features. - The Issue of Provenance. [Acquired from Galery Nefer in Zurich in 1997.] - Edition.
